nameEntry.part: Uniting Church Archives Children's Homes File, Western Australia

biogHist.abstract: The Uniting Church Archives Children's Homes archival series contains a number of items held in a single large file. The contents of the series relate to Children's Homes which were run by the Methodist and Presbyterian Churches. The file is organised into sub-folders related to: Allandale Boys' Home at Werribee, Benmore Presbyterian Children's Home, Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home, Mofflyn and its different cottages and hostels, and also the Methodist Homes for Children, Sister Kate's Child and Family Services (which includes information about becoming Manguri).
biogHist.p: Access to some of these records is restricted to protect the privacy of individuals. You are very welcome to enquire.

The information in the series includes newsletters, correspondence, general historical notes and objects, and editions of newsletters. There are no complete sets of newsletters in this series. This series mostly holds items from the 1960s and 1970s but there are a few items from earlier and later years.

bibref.title: Uniting Church Archives Children's Homes File, Western Australia

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.unittitle: Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore
archref.abstract: 'Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore' is a digital copy of the program printed for the opening of the Benmore Presbyterian Children's Home in 1947. It has images and history about the Benmore and Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Homes, a plan of Benmore and a list of the Home's 'needs'. A photocopy of this program is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.unittitle: The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]
archref.abstract: 'The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]' is a digital copy of an excerpt from a report given to the Presbyterian Church by the committee that ran the Burnbrae and Benmore Presbyterian Children's Homes. A photocopy of this report is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.abstract: 'Report of Childrens Homes Committee, 1939 [excerpt]' is a digital copy of an exerpt from a report given to the Presbyterian Church by the committee established to develop and run children's Homes on behalf of the church in Western Australia. A photocopy of this report is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1978 edition, published under the banner of the Uniting Church Child and Family Care Services. It has a map and a list of all the Homes in the metropolitan area that came under the control of the Uniting Church after the union of the Methodist, Presbyterian and Congregational churches in 1977. There is an article about how some children came into care and also news about how some of the Homes are funded. There is some specific information about Terrace House, Sister Kate Clutterbuck and the Mogumber Training Centre. The newsletter appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1974 edition. It has a picture of some young children 'helping out' by sweeping the front steps at Mofflyn. There are also photos of other children and buildings. The news items give a small amount of information about each Home and news about the staff. The newsletter also appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1970 edition. It has a picture of some children playing at Mofflyn and a photo of the front of the Allandale Boys' Cottage at 149 Sussex Street. The news items give a small amount of information about each Home and talk about some planned 'scatter homes'. There is news about the retirement of Matron Roberts and a photo of her with some kindergarten children. The newsletter also appeals for funds, explains how previous support has helped, and lets readers know what more they can do

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. This is a copy of the December 1966 edition. It has a picture of the new hostel ('Cooinda') in Mt Lawley and a photo of some young women who lived there. There are also photos of buildings at the Mofflyn site in Victoria Park and a photo of children with 'Father Christmas'. There is news about donations and activities in the other Homes. The newsletter also tells readers how they can help.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.abstract: The 'Homes' Herald was a newsletter of the Methodist Homes for Children. The December 1965 edition is held in the Children's Homes File at the Uniting Church Archive in Perth. This edition has a photo of some kindergarten children acting in their Christmas play. There are also photos of buildings and children at the Mofflyn site in Victoria Park and information about the Homes and children's activities.

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.abstract: 'Mofflyn turns back the pages' is an article that was published in the Uniting Church's journal Western Impact. It shares one person's memories of living at the Methodist Children's Home and tells some of the history of that Home, which became 'Mofflyn'.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Methodist Homes for Children street appeal, 1970

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.unittitle: Methodist Homes for Children street appeal, 1970
archref.abstract: This is a copy of a letter from the Methodist Homes for Children to members of the Methodist Church Guild. It gives instructions about how to help with the annual street appeal that raised funds for the Methodist Homes for Children. The letter says that the 'target' for the 1970 street appeal was $3,000, which would be around $30,000 now.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: List of needs, Methodist Homes for Children

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives
archref.unittitle: List of needs, Methodist Homes for Children
archref.abstract:
This is a copy of a list of items that were needed for children in the Methodist Homes for Children in Western Australia. There is no date on the item, but it is filed in the Uniting Church Archives with other items from the 1970s. This list may have been sent to people who were interested in making donations to the Methodist Homes for Children. The list includes ideas about suitable:
Clothing
School items
Sporting equipment
Christmas and birthday presents
Household items for the Homes
